channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: PIAFusion: A progressive infrared and visible image fusion network based on illumination aware
item.description: Moreover, we utilize the illumination probability to construct an illumination-aware loss to guide the training of the fusion network.

item.title: Asymmetry Disentanglement Network for Interpretable Acute Ischemic Stroke Infarct Segmentation in Non-Contrast CT Scans
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Asymmetry Disentanglement Network (ADN) to automatically separate pathological asymmetries and intrinsic anatomical asymmetries in NCCTs for more effective and interpretable AIS segmentation.

item.title: Forecasting Future World Events with Neural Networks
item.description: We test language models on our forecasting task and find that performance is far below a human expert baseline.

item.title: Shifts 2.0: Extending The Dataset of Real Distributional Shifts
item.description: This creates a need to be able to assess how robustly ML models generalize as well as the quality of their uncertainty estimates.

item.title: ZeroC: A Neuro-Symbolic Model for Zero-shot Concept Recognition and Acquisition at Inference Time
item.description: In this work, we introduce Zero-shot Concept Recognition and Acquisition (ZeroC), a neuro-symbolic architecture that can recognize and acquire novel concepts in a zero-shot way.

item.title: Efficient Entity Candidate Generation for Low-Resource Languages
item.description: We also propose a light-weight and simple solution based on the construction of indexes whose design is motivated by more complex transfer learning based neural approaches.

item.title: Multiclass-SGCN: Sparse Graph-based Trajectory Prediction with Agent Class Embedding
item.description: Trajectory prediction of road users in real-world scenarios is challenging because their movement patterns are stochastic and complex.

item.title: Masked Part-Of-Speech Model: Does Modeling Long Context Help Unsupervised POS-tagging?
item.description: MPoSM can model arbitrary tag dependency and perform POS induction through the objective of masked POS reconstruction.

item.title: Grouped Pointwise Convolutions Reduce Parameters in Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: In Deep Convolutional Neural Networks (DCNNs), the parameter count in pointwise convolutions quickly grows due to the multiplication of the filters and input channels from the preceding layer.

item.title: DFGC 2022: The Second DeepFake Game Competition
item.description: There is a two-party game between DeepFake creators and defenders.

item.title: Exposing and addressing the fragility of neural networks in digital pathology
item.description: In this study, we develop a new method for evaluating neural network models' ability to generalise by generating a large number of distribution-shifted datasets, which can be used to thoroughly investigate their robustness to variability encountered in clinical practice.

item.title: Benchmarking the Robustness of Deep Neural Networks to Common Corruptions in Digital Pathology
item.description: Evaluated on two resulting benchmark datasets, we find that (1) a variety of deep neural network models suffer from a significant accuracy decrease (double the error on clean images) and the unreliable confidence estimation on corrupted images; (2) A low correlation between the validation and test errors while replacing the validation set with our benchmark can increase the correlation.

item.title: A Unified End-to-End Retriever-Reader Framework for Knowledge-based VQA
item.description: On the other hand, pertaining to the implicit knowledge, the multi-modal implicit knowledge for knowledge-based VQA still remains largely unexplored.

item.title: Neural Rendering for Stereo 3D Reconstruction of Deformable Tissues in Robotic Surgery
item.description: Reconstruction of the soft tissues in robotic surgery from endoscopic stereo videos is important for many applications such as intra-operative navigation and image-guided robotic surgery automation.

item.title: Localizing the Recurrent Laryngeal Nerve via Ultrasound with a Bayesian Shape Framework
item.description: Tumor infiltration of the recurrent laryngeal nerve (RLN) is a contraindication for robotic thyroidectomy and can be difficult to detect via standard laryngoscopy.

item.title: Skeleton-based Action Recognition via Adaptive Cross-Form Learning
item.description: Specifically, each GCN model in ACFL not only learns action representation from the single-form skeletons, but also adaptively mimics useful representations derived from other forms of skeletons.

item.title: Multi-Granularity Regularized Re-Balancing for Class Incremental Learning
item.description: Re-balancing methods are used to alleviate the influence of data imbalance; however, we empirically discover that they would under-fit new classes.

item.title: The (de)biasing effect of GAN-based augmentation methods on skin lesion images
item.description: In addition, we examined classification models trained on both real and synthetic data with counterfactual bias explanations.

item.title: MEAD: A Multi-Armed Approach for Evaluation of Adversarial Examples Detectors
item.description: Detection of adversarial examples has been a hot topic in the last years due to its importance for safely deploying machine learning algorithms in critical applications.

item.title: HRFuser: A Multi-resolution Sensor Fusion Architecture for 2D Object Detection
item.description: Besides standard cameras, autonomous vehicles typically include multiple additional sensors, such as lidars and radars, which help acquire richer information for perceiving the content of the driving scene.

item.title: Interpretable Anomaly Detection in Echocardiograms with Dynamic Variational Trajectory Models
item.description: We propose a novel anomaly detection method for echocardiogram videos.

item.title: BigBIO: A Framework for Data-Centric Biomedical Natural Language Processing
item.description: Training and evaluating language models increasingly requires the construction of meta-datasets --diverse collections of curated data with clear provenance.

item.title: Laplacian Autoencoders for Learning Stochastic Representations
item.description: Representation learning has become a practical family of methods for building rich parametric codifications of massive high-dimensional data while succeeding in the reconstruction side.

item.title: Scalable K-FAC Training for Deep Neural Networks with Distributed Preconditioning
item.description: The second-order optimization methods, notably the D-KFAC (Distributed Kronecker Factored Approximate Curvature) algorithms, have gained traction on accelerating deep neural network (DNN) training on GPU clusters.

item.title: AnoShift: A Distribution Shift Benchmark for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection
item.description: We validate the performance degradation over time with diverse models (MLM to classical Isolation Forest).

item.title: Denoised MDPs: Learning World Models Better Than the World Itself
item.description: The ability to separate signal from noise, and reason with clean abstractions, is critical to intelligence.

item.title: Learning Functions on Multiple Sets using Multi-Set Transformers
item.description: We propose a general deep architecture for learning functions on multiple permutation-invariant sets.

item.title: Improving Ensemble Distillation With Weight Averaging and Diversifying Perturbation
item.description: Ensembles of deep neural networks have demonstrated superior performance, but their heavy computational cost hinders applying them for resource-limited environments.

item.title: Benchmark Dataset for Precipitation Forecasting by Post-Processing the Numerical Weather Prediction
item.description: In this work, we present a hybrid NWP-DL workflow to fill the gap between standalone NWP and DL approaches.

item.title: On the Learning and Learnablity of Quasimetrics
item.description: In contrast, our proposed Poisson Quasimetric Embedding (PQE) is the first quasimetric learning formulation that both is learnable with gradient-based optimization and enjoys strong performance guarantees.

item.title: GitHub Copilot AI pair programmer: Asset or Liability?
item.description: In this paper, we study the capabilities of Copilot in two different programming tasks: (1) generating (and reproducing) correct and efficient solutions for fundamental algorithmic problems, and (2) comparing Copilot's proposed solutions with those of human programmers on a set of programming tasks.

item.title: Transfer Learning with Deep Tabular Models
item.description: In this work, we demonstrate that upstream data gives tabular neural networks a decisive advantage over widely used GBDT models.

item.title: Understanding Instance-Level Impact of Fairness Constraints
item.description: A variety of fairness constraints have been proposed in the literature to mitigate group-level statistical bias.

item.title: Color-aware two-branch DCNN for efficient plant disease classification
item.description: Deep convolutional neural networks (DCNNs) have been successfully applied to plant disease detection.

item.title: LViT: Language meets Vision Transformer in Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: In our model, medical text annotation is introduced to compensate for the quality deficiency in image data.

item.title: C2FTrans: Coarse-to-Fine Transformers for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: However, most recent transformer-based methods for medical image segmentation directly apply vanilla transformers as an auxiliary module in CNN-based methods, resulting in severe detail loss due to the rigid patch partitioning scheme in transformers.

item.title: Towards out of distribution generalization for problems in mechanics
item.description: To address this, we investigate the performance of OOD generalization methods for regression problems in mechanics.

item.title: An extensible Benchmarking Graph-Mesh dataset for studying Steady-State Incompressible Navier-Stokes Equations
item.description: Recent progress in \emph{Geometric Deep Learning} (GDL) has shown its potential to provide powerful data-driven models.

item.title: Distilling Model Failures as Directions in Latent Space
item.description: Existing methods for isolating hard subpopulations and spurious correlations in datasets often require human intervention.

item.title: On the Robustness of Dialogue History Representation in Conversational Question Answering: A Comprehensive Study and a New Prompt-based Method
item.description: We find that high benchmark scores do not necessarily translate to strong robustness, and that various methods can perform extremely differently under different settings.

item.title: Technical Report for CVPR 2022 LOVEU AQTC Challenge
item.description: This technical report presents the 2nd winning model for AQTC, a task newly introduced in CVPR 2022 LOng-form VidEo Understanding (LOVEU) challenges.

item.title: SRCN3D: Sparse R-CNN 3D Surround-View Camera Object Detection and Tracking for Autonomous Driving
item.description: This paper proposes Sparse R-CNN 3D (SRCN3D), a novel two-stage fully-convolutional mapping pipeline for surround-view camera detection and tracking.

item.title: Online vs. Offline Adaptive Domain Randomization Benchmark
item.description: However, transferring the acquired knowledge to the real world can be challenging due to the reality gap.

item.title: Visual Foresight With a Local Dynamics Model
item.description: By combining the LDM with model-free policy learning, we can learn policies which can solve complex manipulation tasks using one-step lookahead planning.

item.title: Summarizing Videos using Concentrated Attention and Considering the Uniqueness and Diversity of the Video Frames
item.description: Instead of simply modeling the frames' dependencies based on global attention, our method integrates a concentrated attention mechanism that is able to focus on non-overlapping blocks in the main diagonal of the attention matrix, and to enrich the existing information by extracting and exploiting knowledge about the uniqueness and diversity of the associated frames of the video.

item.title: Procrustes Analysis with Deformations: A Closed-Form Solution by Eigenvalue Decomposition
item.description: We show that this property fortunately holds true for most common transformation models, including the affine and TPS models.

item.title: GERNERMED++: Transfer Learning in German Medical NLP
item.description: We present a statistical model for German medical natural language processing trained for named entity recognition (NER) as an open, publicly available model.

item.title: The Lighter The Better: Rethinking Transformers in Medical Image Segmentation Through Adaptive Pruning
item.description: To our best knowledge, this is the first work on transformer pruning for medical image analysis tasks.

item.title: Placenta Segmentation in Ultrasound Imaging: Addressing Sources of Uncertainty and Limited Field-of-View
item.description: Automatic segmentation of the placenta in fetal ultrasound (US) is challenging due to the (i) high diversity of placenta appearance, (ii) the restricted quality in US resulting in highly variable reference annotations, and (iii) the limited field-of-view of US prohibiting whole placenta assessment at late gestation.

item.title: On Non-Random Missing Labels in Semi-Supervised Learning
item.description: Our method is three-fold: 1) We propose Class-Aware Propensity (CAP) that exploits the unlabeled data to train an improved classifier using the biased labeled data.
